title: Reminders icons
body: would it be possible to set other icons than „✓”? this would help with readability of ongoing reminders

title: Tasks not visible on the lock screen
body:
No matter how I adjust the settings of notifications for Notable Plus, the notifications do not appear on the lock screen. 

I'm on Android 7.1.2

title: French translation + README.md
body:
Hello, this small PR completes the French translation, and adds two buttons in the README.md to easily access F-Droid and Google Play

You can ping me in the future if there are any new keys to translate ;)

Thanks for this app :)

title: Feature Request: Would it be possible to close instead of minimize the app after adding a new note?
body:
The only issue I have with Notable is that after I add a new note Notable will minimize itself instead of closing completely. If I press the Overview button the Notable window will still appear in the list and I will need to manually swipe it to close the app for good and get it out of the way. 

Is this something that could be fixed?

I'm using NotablePlus x1.5.8 (installed from F-Droid) on LineageOS 14.1

---

(BTW, I would like to thank you very much for developing this app. It is the best note-taking one I could find and I love its minimalism)

title: Notable opens itself after unlocking the phone
body:
Hi,
I have the popup to enter a new task right after unlocking my phone with the fingerprint sensor.
Thank you.

Android 7.1.2 // latest F-droid build: 1.6.0

title: Add jcenter() repo to buildscript deps
body: `com.android.tools.build:gradle:2.3.2` is not available in mavenCentral, but jCenter. You most likely havent noticed this because you have it already available locally and AndroidStudio does auto-fix those issues.

title: Code updates and new features
body: I've added a new option to make it easier to add multiple notes and an option to show the notes on the lock screen.

title: Useless parentheses around expressions should be removed
body:
This pull request is focused on resolving occurrences of Sonar rule 
squid:UselessParenthesesCheck - “ Useless parentheses around expressions should be removed to prevent any misunderstanding ”. 
You can find more information about the issue here: 
https://dev.eclipse.org/sonar/rules/show/squid:UselessParenthesesCheck
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Ayman Abdelghany.

title: Feature Request: Priority based on color
body:
As of now the notification priority can be set generally to normal, low or minimum. Also, there's four different colors for the notification icon.

It would be nice to have an option to tie those colors to different priorities. (Alternatively there could be a separate priority setting when creating notes. But I think my idea would keep it simple.)

title: Feature Request: Setting alarm to appear later
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: I love the app. I think it would be very useful to be able to offer the option in the configuration options that when you set an alarm the notification will only appear at the time of that alarm. Thiis way, you could for instance write down to turn off the oven, and the notification would only appear at the time you wanted, not having it all the time there when there is no use and only taking up a precious space.

title: cannot access to the setting dialog
body: Every time i choose "setting" the app close

title: Feature Request: Save Completed Notes in Text File
Fix expanded text showing "Notable"; disable "expand buttons" setting for Android 4.0-; refactoring
body:
I fixed the issue with "Notable" showing up in rich notifications on Android 4.1+. It was due to the default value of "long text". I added a database upgrade so old notifications' long text will be fixed too.
Other changes are described in commit messages.

title: Remove automatic second line, fix a crash, a little refactoring
body:
Hi, first of all thanks for the app :)
I made this pull request because I though adding "Notable" as a second line to single-line notifications was a bit irritating so I removed it. If you had a special reason for adding that second line, maybe we can discuss a better way to do that.
Also, I fixed a crash in the following case. Create a reminder, then click the notification to open its detail view, dismiss the reminder, then go to Recent Apps and click Notable. The app crashes because it tries to open a detail view for a reminder that has already been deleted.
Finally, I made a little refactoring, most important of which is making the Notable app inherit the library's manifest instead of copying it. It has a small downside that ADT doesn't find the launcher activity (which is its bug) so when you launch the app from Eclipse, it just installs it but doesn't launch it. I think this is an acceptable price for not having to duplicate every change that you make to the library's manifest.
Looking forward to getting these changes as an update from Play :)
